conclusion: Analyze the acceleration-displacement graph to determine velocity at \( x_1 \).

Graph shows acceleration \( a \) vs displacement \( x \) with three segments: constant \( a_0 \) from \( x = 0 \) to \( x_1 \), zero from \( x_1 \) to \( x_2 \), linearly decreasing to zero from \( x_2 \) to \( x_3 \).
Acceleration is constant at \( a_0 \) from \( x = 0 \) to \( x_1 \).
Object's initial velocity \( v_0 \) is zero.
Calculate velocity \( v_1 \) at \( x_1 \) using \( v_1 = v_0 + a_0 x_1 \).
Substitute \( v_0 = 0 \) to get \( v_1 = a_0 x_1 \).
Velocity at \( x_1 \) is \( a_0 x_1 \).
